author: Sweete88
title: First visit to zone 4 left me struggling to sleep
body:
The ill-treatment I witnessed and received from zone 4 has completely traumatised me and I have been left feeling guilty for not saying anything because I couldn't bare the thought of another pregnant woman having to go through what I went through.  
This is my first pregnancy and my first time in zone 4 but not in my wildest dream did I think I would experience what I went through but on the bright side, I met an amazing heavily pregnant lady, we were the longest waiting patient in Zone 4, she had been there since 11am and I was there from around 3 or 4pm, I did not leave until around 9 or 10pm and this was all because we were waiting to see a doctor.  
I remembered asking the midwives to let me leave as I did not believe my symptoms was worth seeing a doctor for especially after been tested and was told that everything was fine but they insisted I waited. The only thing that kept me there was my maternity folder which they refused to give back to me. And not surprisingly, by the time the doctor finally decided to see me at around 9pm, they asked why I had decided to come in if I was only having an abdominal discomfort which I found extremely rude after waiting over 5 hours to see him, I then told them that it was my midwife who told me to come into zone 4 and they said I was fine to go.  
My horrendous experience was not only for the waiting time but how inhumane I felt treated and also watched other pregnant women treated the same way especially the ones in worst conditions. This is a new experience for me and I know I'm not the only one but I feel that one of the ways I can heal from this experience is to speak out.  
This system has got to change, it shouldn't be OK to treat people let alone pregnant woman this way. An hospital will not tolerate a patient's rudeness and disrespectful behaviour towards a member of staff so why is it ok for hospital staffs I.e. doctors, nurse, midwives etc to treat patients with such behaviour?

author: Grass
title: Pollinex Immunotherapy
body:
I've been receiving treatment at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary for a severe grass allergy.  
The treatment and staff were absolutely fantastic.

title: Excellent customer service. Brilliant Practice
body: Rang at 8am got through in 2 mins. Requested an appointment with the Dr. The Dr rang me back within 5 minutes, very friendly and helpful. Fabulous service.

title: Shocking
body: I went to A&E with suicidal thoughts and I got seen by CAMHS they said to me that they would put me on the waiting list, I was waiting for months and months, ended up in A&E again, they didn‚Äôt let me home this time, CAMHS came again and they said that they would assess me and put me on the list to be seen, the following week, which never happened, then my school reached out to them again, that I need serious help as they are concerned. I finally got to see a psychiatrist and a therapist and they did literally nothing. All they said to me was ‚ÄúI can tell you‚Äôre struggling a bit‚Äù and ‚Äúthat is pretty difficult‚Äù. Bare in mind I was crying and begging for help. Their service is absolutely shocking and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone.

author: PeterMcK
title: Brilliant
body: Really well organised and flowed perfectly. Maureen was my vaccinator and she was fantastic. Quick and painless. Plenty of great chat and went about her work in an ultra professional manner.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Superb Treatment
body: I would like to express my sincere gratitude and thanks to the marvellous staff at Worcester Hospital, who cared for me during my recent stay from the 11th- 14th March to repair a broken ankle. From the initial assessment at A&E, where my ankle was deftly relocated by a nurse to the:  consultants, doctors, nurses, health care staff and ultimately surgeons and anaesthetists involved in my treatment and surgery on both the surgical and T&O wards; I was completely impressed by their dedication, incredible skill and hard work during very long shifts. They always showed compassionate care towards patients. My treatment plan was faultless, cohesive and speedy, involving many departments such as X-ray, Physiotherapy and Occupational Health. I was kept fully informed about treatment, medication and possible outcomes post- surgery, as a patient who needed care and I was never made to feel as if I was just a name on a busy list. I witnessed many incidents of genuine sensitivity and compassion from ward nurses handling patients with complex needs and frankly do not know where they find their energy from during their twelve hour shifts. I have always appreciated and rated the NHS highly but it is only when one witnesses the work of staff, that you are made to realise the enormity of their workload, especially during this pandemic. I wholeheartedly applaud them all and thank everyone involved in my care and especially to the surgical team for putting my ankle back together, also to the recovery nurse for her care post surgery.  I feel that it is very important to mention everyone. You are magnificent! I wish you all good health and a reduction in your workload very soon, along with an increase in staffing and a future very significant pay rise from the Government! Kindest regards, VB

title: Excellent practice
body: I had my second covid injection this morning. Extremely well organized with numerous staff in attendance complete with hand sanitizer. Chair were disinfected after each patient left after having received their vaccination

title: Where is the online consultation service?
body: What does this practice not have access to online consultations for its patients? I thought this was a contractual requirement for every GP practice.

title: Super fast! Very professional
body: Had a CT scan today in the mobile unit at 7:25pm, I was in and out with in 10 minutes, receptionist in X-rayB was lovely, very polite and friendly. The guys in the mobile scanner made me feel at ease, professional and even a little giggle. I was terrified (very claustrophobic) but they put that at ease without me even mentioning it! Could not praise them enough today! Every single member of staff was so pleasant. What an amazing little team and so positive considering the circumstances. I had to leave a positive review! I came away from the hospital smiling with not a single grumble üòÅüòÅ

title: Poor communication response
body:
Overlooked for vaccine appointment.  When posted question on 'askmyGP' was fobbed off with an instant set reply - no investigation of my particular situation at all.  Follow-up request for explanation ignored. It required a terse phone-call before it was acknowledged I should have been called several weeks earlier and a perfunctory apology offered.
Mistakes are made - it happens - what sets people and organisations apart is how they react to them.  If I had been meek and mild and just accepted the fobbing off then presumably I would still be waiting for the vaccine next Christmas.

title: Much improvement needed
body: We had a telephone appointment booked today.  The phone rang and we answered but there was no one on the other line - clearly some connection issues.  During this time we had another call from the GP, we switched to the other call but by then the GP had hung up.  Immediately afterwards we got a text to say we did not attend our appointment.  My partner phoned right after this and got through to the GP surgery who then told her that she missed her appointment and that it would be impossible to speak to the GP and that we would need to book another appointment.  If this appointment was for us, we would not be so upset but it was for our three month old baby who is not entirely well.  We already had problems getting our baby scheduled for his vaccines.  We phoned up to book his 8 week vaccines and were told that we had phoned too early and that they would phone us to book his vaccines.  When they did phone, it was to say they had no appointments available until our baby was 11 weeks.  We both are doctors in the NHS and know the pressures that the service faces.  However, the level of organisation at Stratford Health Centre really leaves a lot to be desired.

title: Vaccine roll out - a credit to you all
body: Excellent vaccine service, organised perfectly by Harcourt, efficiently and professionally delivered by the vaccine teams in Salisbury Cathedral. Well done all!

title: Poor Standards
body: I had an appointment today to have an endoscopy procedure. Which originally was an evening appointment at 6.40 then received a phone call to ask if I could make it to an earlier appointment at 4.20pm so agreed. I was sat for 30mins feeling quite faint after having no food or water since the evening before, following instructions and only small sips of water until two hour prior to the procedure. In those 30 mins in the waiting room there was one person who had no mask at all, one patient not even covering his nose with his mask. I felt really uncomfortable and unsafe. Also feeling dehydrated and ill at this point then to top it all when I asked when will I be going for my procedure, i then got told by a nurse that they were running late and I would have to wait for at least an hour and a half as they were so behind. I was so upset ! Why make appointments for people and ask if they can come earlier, and then be expected to sit in a waiting room with no Covid safe practice going on, I had to leave. How can you expect people to sit there two hours longer after an appointment time with no food or water, which would of been almost 24 hours if I stayed for the procedure. I am going to call my GP tomorrow and ask to go elsewhere for the procedure.

title: Great hospital with phenomenal staff
body:
Following a heart attack I had a quadruple bypass operation on the 5th of February.
The minute I was admitted to the hospital I received the best care and attention I could possibly have had. I was kept well informed about all procedures by doctors, surgeons and technicians, which made me feel safe and in the best of care.
All nurses without exception were simply phenomenal in there professionalism, caring attitude and I found them to be totally dedicated to their patients.
I always felt that I was treated with the utmost of dignity and respect. 
Everybody, including the catering and other supporting staff were simply excellent.
I could not have been in a better place and would recommend this hospital anytime.

author: woodpigeontj79
title: It has worked great for me
body: CMP has worked great for me, its been great, friendly staff have been very helped. I couldnt recommended their services more. Thanks!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: What a fantastic surgery and a fantastic bunch of staff. I came in for my 2nd covid vaccine today and was very impressed with how smoothly run it was yet again :) I just want to thank all admin and reception staff for all your help and the doctors also. Keep up the good work everyone your all doing an amazing job.

title: Fantastically run
body: The staff at the medical centre were all incredibly welcoming and re-assuring. They were very efficient and the practice was very well organised in the process of administering the vaccines.

title: Very caring and reassuring
body: I visited this department after a gp referral. I have to say I was petrified to have the procedure, however all the staff were absolutely amazing, they listened to me, took their time to explain what was happening, and showed so much kindness, all with Covid Secure measures in place. Thank you.

title: Follow-Up Appointment After Bowel Surgery
body:
Saw someone from surgical department this afternoon- not my Consultant.  Never felt so upset after an appointment before.  Disinterested/dismissive of my concerns;, no examination though I am still in pain and still showing worrying symptoms after surgery. Was very matter-of-fact and rude when I asked for an update about something very serious that was also found before my surgery.  More interested in signing me off from clinic even though still not well.

Staff on Wards, ICU, A & E, X-Ray, CT, MRI, Physio, Anti-Coagulation Team have been absolutely brilliant during the last year. Food good for ‚Äòhospital food‚Äô.  I have been in and out of hospital since August last year but some members of Surgical Team‚Äôs attitude has been unhelpful and upsetting.  Not what you need when you have been so ill.  Lack of information and advice a big problem also.  They treat you like you are asking stupid questions even though nothing has been explained to you.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing
body: I was referred to Tameside by my GP under the 2 week waiting list. Thanks to the appointments staff I had an appointment within 2 days of the referral. The staff in Blue suite 1 were very caring and professional. I also had an ultrasound during this appointment and again the staff were very approachable, professional and thorough. I was made to feel at ease throughout, even though it was a stressful situation. I cannot fault the whole process from referral to discharge. Thank you so much for your continued hard work!

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Supportive team
body:
The receptionists have been very helpful and have ensured messages are responded to and communicated to the appropriate GP.
My GP has actively listened to my health concerns with a compassionate patient centred approach.

title: Great GP's and open times
body: This GP is really good, all the staff and helpful and polite, For someone like my self who works mixed hours its good as they open late 7 days a week. I make the most of weekend open times. I phoned last Sunday at 2pm and was able to speak to a GP the same day.

title: Worst worst practise
body:
doctors are worst, staff rude no respect for patience, 
They will say we will call they never do
Worst worst worst worst

title: Poor service  don't answer phone .
body: In reply to your reply . The service is not the best that can be offered I am a receptionist at barnsley hospital and  answer the phone every day to book appointments. And if I thought 1 person had been ringing over 100 times in one day to then be told nothing avaliable. I would be ashamed to do my job . The must be a better way of getting through to see a doctor when needed . And if you see in my previous comment I did ring I heart nearly as many times and to be told exactly the same not avaliable  slots . Needs looking into and not just fobbing people off with poor excuses . Dreadful service

readBy.name: I- Heart Barnsley - Barnsley Healthcare Federation

title: Interventional Radiology -Wonderful staff
body:
I am leaving this Review to say how fantastic  the staff of the interventional radiology department are. The Nurses and staff are truly excellent. I simply cannot praise them highly enough.  I would like to thank them for their professionalism kindness patience and understanding.  
You are outstanding. ‚ô•Ô∏è

title: Extremely poor customer service
body:
I booked and paid just short of ¬£11k for surgery and unfortunately it was cancelled at short notice by Pall Mall. I was offered a full refund or to hopefully have the surgery a month later but I could always get a full refund.
A month later, I was not updated, after chasing a number of times I was told it would be at least another month. Due to the delays the timing was no longer right due to the length of recovery time plus there was still no guarantee of when or if surgery would take place.
I have now been waiting 21 days. Nobody contacts you, returns my calls. I have only received my initial ¬£500 deposit and still waiting on the ¬£10385.
If this is how you are treated, I‚Äôm glad the surgery never went ahead as god forbid anything had gone wrong their shoddy customer service would not have been there to help.

title: Bad
body: Never ring back the staff on where u make appointments told me twice I would have a call back from the diabetes nurse still waiting now that of lies unhelpful and rude will be moving from this surgery

author: Willowbank
title: Couldn't get seen
body:
Appointment system  
This practice has over 15k patients on the register and barely any full time doctors !  
I have to phone at 8am to get an appointment and by 8.30 after being number 50th in the queue I am told there‚Äôs no appointments left !  
Tried every day for 3 weeks for a lump and couldn‚Äôt get seen yet the surgery lately has been blaming Covid for this however this was happening for a good few years prior to Covid .  
Sub contracted out by the nhs but nhs had to take over again due to 2-3 week turnaround for repeat prescriptions and other issues which ended up in our local paper . Appointment system has been a shambles . Why have so many patients If they don‚Äôt have the staff to attend to them !!

title: Dystopian nightmare
body:
Since Covid this surgery have put up a series of infuriating barriers to prevent even the most basic communication between the surgery and the patients from taking place. Instead of being able to talk to a human, you are directed to fill in an infuriating form full of irrelevant questions online. The form then directs you to contact 111. I have done this and found myself filling in the same form, only to be told to contact my GP. It's this impossible loop that I suppose they wish to keep you busy in to avoid contacting anyone. 
Yesterday I somehow managed to get the form to say the  GP would contact me. I then got a text back asking for a photo of an issue I couldn't photograph. I filled in another form trying to explain this. I then received a text telling me to send the photo as soon as possible. The "communication" ended there. I feel cut off and alienated and without a GP to be honest. I guess if the purpose of this system is to put up a barrier between patients and the surgery it really works. At the moment I feel as though I have no GP and neither does my child. 
I worry that all GPs are now using the same system. Perhaps this is the idea.

title: Amazing hospital and an amazing team
body:
It was finally time for me to have a new knee after an elongated waiting time as we came out of lockdown in the Covid era and I was a little nervous to come to this hospital outside of my normal area area
The hospital and its teams were superb . Its immaculately clean , fully working Covid controls in place and the quality of care is outstanding . Throughout my entire stay , and without exception , regardless of role of grade , everyone was patient , and caring and focused on my recovery .
This really is a wonderful hospital

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lack of details on website - woefully short of‚Ä¶
body: Unable to find any information relating to xray department - times, location, procedures - woefully inadequate website, seems to be from a "forgotten age".

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

author: rev1
title: Admitted with a fractured femur
body:
In November 2020 I was admitted to Raigmore hospital with a fractured femur.
A pre admission Doctor was dispatched to the ambulance and made me comfortable for my transfer to Raigmore. After surgery I suffered post operative complications resulting in my admission to HDU and ICU and eventually ward 7C before being transferred to invergordon county hospital for intense physio.
My stay encompassed some ten weeks.
I am extremely grateful for the skills of all you staff in each unit along with their care and kindness not only to me but to my family who were called on at least four occasions to be told I probably would not survive.
The idea of the emergency pre admission doctor is very good idea and to be commended

author: Niccc91
title: Excellence on every level
body:
I suffered an unstable fracture.  
I was transferred to Edenhall Spinal Injuries Unit for care and surgery.  
The care is second to none. I will be eternally grateful to the Spinal Injures team, Mr Alan and Mr McLean.  
Unfortunately for our family, lightening did strike twice.  
My father fell and fractured his spine 8 weeks ago. He is being transferred to the Edenhall ward today and I have every confidence the team there will save his life, as they did mine.  
Words are not enough... thank you QE spinal injuries department.

author: CA1999
title: Peterhead Ultrasound
body:
I attended Peterhead Community Hospital today for an out patient ultrasound scan.  
I received exceptional care. The department, despite being busy, was well run and very clean.  
The specialist sonographer was patient, kind, reassuring and explained everything with informative detail. A professional with exceptional knowledge, a credit to the radiography profession.  
I am very reassured that we have such excellent services in our local area. I hope that excellence is recognised by the organisation.  
Thank you again and keep up the good work.

author: bravosb36
title: Unable to contact department
body: I was booked for an echocardiogram at St John's Hospital, Livingston in March 2021. As a result of having to self isolate, I was unable to attend. After being contact traced at midday on the day before the appointment, I tried that entire afternoon, early evening and the following morning to call the department at SJH to cancel, however even after ringing almost repeatedly to make staff aware, the number simply rang out unanswered, even after going through the switchboard on occasions. I have now not been given a new appointment, but advised to recontact the department...... on the number that remained unanswered when I tried to contact them last time!

title: Not very happy
body: Unable to get appointments or get phone consultation, even though written to practice manager, when I phone keep being put off they will be ringing me, this is after having to listen to the covic thing every time before being transferred to operator, andthen after pressingnnumber has engaged tone before being cut off. What doin do?

title: Great Barr Medical Centre
body:
I think this practice is the best ever - the service is very efficient
the receptionist and the Doctor that done my Covid Vaccination was very professional - they made me feel very comfortable

author: squatrm45
title: Broken hip during a pandemic
body:
In February my 90 year old mother had a fall at home and unfortunately her alert band did not work. When I got there having been unable to contact her on the phone she had been on the floor for 5 hours. Within 10 minutes of me contacting the alarm company a team had arrived but could not move her as they suspected a broken hip, and told me to call an ambulance. I did this just before 10pm and the ambulance arrived at 5am. The crew who arrived were great at helping my mum and reassuring her as she was getting sore and agitated due to the time she had been on the floor.  
I would like thank ambulance control who kept in touch with me at regular intervals giving me advice on checking her and speaking to my mum to keep her reassured that they were doing their best. The contact kept both of us feeling calm in a situation that could not be helped. The support was excellent. So thank you. My mum was taken to Glasgow Royal Infirmary and I was told to call A&E in about an hour. I did so and spoke to the Dr.(Chris?) who gave me a great deal of information on her condition and called me back again (despite having finished his shift) to let me know she was going to be seen by the orthopaedic registrar. He duly called me and said she would need an operation. My next call was regarding DNR and the doctor was very honest but sympathetic. I was then called a few hours later by the consultant anaesthetist to let me know she was in recovery and would I like to speak to her. I am amazed and so thankful to all of these people for their contact and support when everything is so difficult. In the space 21 hours in the middle of a pandemic my mum had a new hip! Amazing! I really can't thank you all enough.She then went to Ward 62 and I was called with an update as soon as she arrived and was kept fully informed for the next week before she was transferred to Ward 3A at Gartnavel. Again I was contacted as soon as she arrived. She spent 3 weeks in 3A where she received excellent care that got her back on her feet and home with a full care package.To everyone involved in my mums care in both hospitals, thank you from the bottom of my heart. I wish I knew all of your names so that I could make this more personal.You managed to get a frail 90 year old up and walking and back home in 4 weeks and turned a traumatic experience for both of us into positive one. Everyone I had contact with in both hospitals made me feel reassured and included.My mum is progressing well at home with the support of the home care staff, occupational therapist, physiotherapist, pharmacist and GP. I can't believe the amount of people that have been involved and continue to be involved in her care and the way it has all come together to get where we are.  
Once again thank you to all of you from both of us. We are so lucky to have all of this available to us on a daily basis. You are all amazing!

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

title: impossible to contact by phone at all
body: I have tried phoning early, later on, nobody ever answers even if you let it ring for 20 minutes or more. What's the point of having a surgery if nobody can talk to you? It's no wonder people get frustrated.

title: Excellent care
body:
I recently stayed on ward B after having a tkr. 
The level of care and compassion I received was brilliant throughout, with nothing being too much trouble  I felt safe and looked after the whole time I was there. I‚Äôd like to thank all of you for helping me, it‚Äôs very much appreciated.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

author: Muppetfoz
title: Birth of my baby
body:
In the early hours of Sunday 13th December, I arrived in the triage unit having phoned to say my contractions were regular and strong. My husband and I were greeted by Sophie, a newly qualified midwife (her first week!) who helped me to a bed space and did my initial assessment. I was much further on than any of us expected (my first labour took over 3 days in total) and things were escalating quickly - I declared I needed to push about 5 minutes after arriving in the triage unit, but Sophie coped brilliantly by getting a more experienced midwife to confirm I needed to get to the midwife led unit ASAP!  
Within minutes I was through in the MLU, welcomed by another midwife and healthcare support worker (I've forgotten their names but hopefully with dates provided they can be identified) who were absolutely fantastic. They worked really well as a team to encourage and support me, and included my husband in everything. Within 20 minutes of guided pushing our son was safely delivered, and I was immediately given skin to skin and delayed cord clamping as written in my notes. How they had the time to read my notes is beyond me, but it's a shining example of how professional this duo were. They made both my husband and I feel relaxed and safe, and took the time to answer questions and encouraged my husband to also have skin to skin with our baby. I did, unfortunately, suffer a tear that had to be repaired in theatre but this was yet another positive experience in my delivery journey.  
The entire theatre team I encountered (I was in theatre during the shift change so met both night staff and day staff) were incredible. James, the anaesthetic assistant and Dr Campbell, the anaesthetist, deserve a special mention as they ensured the spinal injection procedure was swift and relatively painless and chatted to me throughout. The rest of the team in theatre (too many names to remember!) were extremely professional and it was evident that they all enjoy their jobs and like working together. It was a lovely, friendly atmosphere and I could not have asked for better care. I received the same high standard of care in recovery, where I was reunited with my husband and son. We were able to have a couple of hours together while I recovered and ate my weight in toast and tea. Again, the recovery staff were brilliant - friendly and supportive, nothing was too much trouble.  
I had to stay overnight in Summerfield ward, and received excellent care there also. I was in a 4 bed room by myself initially, the staff were always popping in to make sure I was ok and would check if I needed anything. They were friendly and approachable, again nothing seemed too much trouble. This was especially welcome given my husband wasn't allowed to stay due to the covid restrictions. I was encouraged during my attempts to breastfeed, and was supported by a fantastic healthcare support worker while I had a breakdown and decided breastfeeding wasn't for me. At no time did anyone make me feel like I was wrong for making this decision, I was given encouragement and assurance that I was doing what was right for me.  
Overall my birth experience at AMH was brilliant, I can't fault a single aspect of the care I received at any point. Every member of staff I encountered was professional, friendly and genuinely seemed to care about the patients and love what they do. My sincere thanks and gratitude to each and every one, you are all a credit to your departments and to the NHS.

author: uniformwg36
title: Care of my mother
body: My mum was admitted to the Langlands Unit Ward 54 at the Queen Elizabeth hospital for the elderly with a suspected infection. Sadly my mum was diagnosed with advanced cancer. The care and compassion shown by all staff - nurses, auxiliaries, palliative care and the doctors was exceptional. This brought us comfort at a very difficult time especially in these unprecedented circumstances. The staff were there continuously there to support us throughout.

readBy.name: University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Lauramac95
title: My Papa's Experience
body: My Papa was admitted to B32 last week after being told the devastating news he had esophageal cancer. Being told this news is heartbreaking but even more so with Covid restrictions which made this news extremely hard for my Papa to fully understand. The nurses in B32 delivered such a high standard of care and made my Papa feel a little less scared. One nurse in particular Jijo  is a truly wonderful nurse and my Papa will be forever grateful to him. Thank you to all the staff for looking after my Papa during this very difficult time.

title: Frustrating
body: I‚Äôm so annoyed and frustrated with this surgery . I‚Äôve been trying for two days to get through to make an appointment. I‚Äôve started my call this morning at 8am and at 8-50 am when I got through was told all the appointments have gone . The person was abrupt and had the couldnt care less attitude . I wasn‚Äôt very polite either as it‚Äôs so frustrating waiting at the end of a phone for 50 mins to be told phone back tomorrow . What‚Äôs the point as I will have the same response . Covid is getting blamed for all of this but surely someone with good interpersonal skills could deal with appointments and deal with patient enquires  The whole system needs addressing . However not all the staff are rude and the doctors when you do finally speak to them or see them are fantastic . Please sort this as I often think about the elderly patients what would happen to them and how do they get to see a doctor when needed

title: Very positive experience
body: Everything was handled extremely professional and efficient. Very friendly staff. At no point did I feel uncomfortable or afraid of being exposed to the virus. All the precautions were in place.

title: Wonderful staff
body: At a recent appointment to see the Nurse I thought it was time to actually commend all the staff at the key medical practice . Throughout lockdown the care provided has been excellent and the staff are so patient and always listen to our worries!!! The nurse team is outstanding and I feel they should all be commended.

title: Good practice with helpful Dr. And staff
body:
Very good GP practice. The staff and Dr. Is so helpful and very cooperative. Dr. Take times to listen carefully and no rush to get rid of you.
Specially in Corona pandemic situation they all go extra miles to help the patrons. My wife's got arthritis and sometimes she suffered a lot, but surgery always there to help her. We wishing them all a very best of luck for their health and well-being and bright future.

title: Excellent Care
body: I wish to thank the dedicated, proffessional, hard working, caring staff who looked after me during my serveral visits to Birmingham Eye Hospital. Please pass on my thanks for the brilliant work carried out by all of the staff.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent and caring
body:
Over the past 3 weeks I have received treatment and support from the Welton doctors and nurse. I felt listened to and understood, and that my care was thoughtful and personalised. 
Thank you.

author: marchyw35
title: Ward 18, 19a, OPD 4 Plastics
body:
My Dad required an operation to remove a lump under is axilla. He was admitted to ward 19a pre and post surgery. The nursing and medical care he received was excellent. This took place during the C19 pandemic, at the end of the 2nd wave, the fact that NHS Lothian were still able to provide this level of healthcare during this very challenging time is exemplary.  
Obviously as a family we were not allowed to visit my dad for the duration of his inpatient admission (approx. 3 weeks). As the agreed representative for the family, I would call the ward every day to get an update on his care and treatment. Each time the designated nurse for my dad that day, took the time to take my call, answer my question and provide the information so that I could reassure my dad what was happening ( he got a bit mixed up sometimes) and importantly reassure my mum at home.  
Unfortunately he developed a wound infection and so this delayed his discharge. He was transferred to Ward 18 toward the end of his stay and then discharged, with a follow up appointment at OPD 4, Plastics out patients. He was seen by Emma, the Plastics nurse and she allowed me to come into his appointment so I could keep up to date with his recovery. She was so helpful and just lovely, reassuring my dad and myself. He had however, to be readmitted to ward 18 at that appointment as the infection was increasing again. Again, the care he received there was excellent, at his point of discharge a few days later, the discharge plan was explained to me and he left with a good follow up plan in place.  
He is now back at home with a wound that is improving every day. On behalf of my family I would like to express our thanks for taking such good care of my dad at a time when we were not able to visit him.

author: fluteqe63
title: End of life care during a global pandemic
body: Mum was admitted to hospital 23rd Feb 2021.She sadly died on 21st March 2021. From the moment she was admitted by ambulance to her passing all staff showed great sensitivity, care and professional attention of the highest quality. The family would like to express our gratitude to the ambulance crew, ARU5, and especially the exceptional team in ward 54 Langlands. We could not have asked for anything better from the whole staff team in ward 54. They looked after us making sure we were as comfortable as was possible. The family would also like to thank everyone involved for their kind support to us as a family unit during these challenging times. We feel blessed that we were able to be with mum to the very end. Thank you all so much your support and kindness has helped us through this sad time.

readBy.name: University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Lucy81
title: Endoscopy
body:
I spent 2 hours in the endoscopy unit. From start to finish the staff were amazing and really put me at ease. I decided against sedation and opted for the throat numbing spray. My only criticism is that the throat numbing spray could do with a better flavour banana and menthol I don't think so. I received my result before I even left the treatment room and went straight home after with no need to stay in recovery.  
An excellent team I could not fault them in anyway.

title: Would recommend this place
body: I have had health problems in the past so I definitely know a good GP when I see one, and I am really sensitive to it.  I had a long-term locum here and she was excellent, I have always asked for her afterwards.  My partner sees another GP and is also happy with him.  The reception staff have the customer care that you would dream of and yet seems impossible at other NHS practices, often due to being over worked.  The only area for improvement was the blood test lady 'gossiped' about her last patient and - during an appointment about how to reduce cholesterol - she did not give advice on this so it was a waste of time.

author: Monkey75
title: Bibury Ward
body:
I wish to sincerely thank all the staff on Bibury ward for looking after me during my recent stay 17th - 21st March 2021.  
The staff are fantastic and do an amazing job, patient care is done professionally, caring, supportively and with utmost courtesy to the patient. Nothing is too much trouble.  
The staff have done amazing especially during the pandemic, patient care is their main focus.  
I cannot thank them enough as this was my first stay in hospital and they made it an easy one. I would return as a patient there in the future - hopefully this won‚Äôt need to happen.  
Thank you so much to you all, Nurses, Domestics and Doctors.

author: equuleusfe93
title: Going for a procedure
body: Tests done and very straight forward and very helpful

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: runningsr39
title: Birth of my 2nd child
body:
I gave birth to my 2nd child a beautiful baby girl with the midwifes in the birthing pool, i cannot fault them in anyway, they are very supportive and caring towards myself and my partner. I would hightly recommed birth with the midwife at peterhead as the experience was very calming never rushed all in your time, they was always there to help and never left you feeling like a burden.  
Honestly cant thank the ladies enough they do an amazing job

author: Dralexmac
title: Grade 3 pressure area on sacrum
body: Professional approach to diagnosing assessing and management of wound. Regular reviews and dressings

author: atlasfh78
title: Community Adult Physiotherapy
body: Since Caroline has been coming to me to get me to walk again after my broken ankle. She has been absolutely fantastic. She gives me the encouragement to try the things I need to do and I feel absolutely safe in her care. She is friendly and so nice. She also takes time with you. I can now go upstairs to bed which I could not before and go down the step into the bathroom. She has showed me how to get into the shower. She is kind and considerate and you never feel you are being rushed with her when she comes. I must admit I will miss her visits. Thank you Caroline for all your help and guidance, you have been fantastic. I wish you well.

author: Toormore
title: Talking therapy and psychological support
body:
following a significant issue that presented itself in my workplace, and involved external investigations at a legal level, I needed to get some support to help me overcome the stress and trauma of the 4 months during which the ordeal had gone on.  
i approached my GP, who gave me time on the phone (in the evening), was v empathetic, and suggested a number of routes, including the back on track solution.  
I was assessed for support, to determine was was the best approach and I was recommended a number of tools, the major one being talking therapy, CBT, and sldso webinars on. stress management and mindfulness.  
I found the therapist Omur to be an excellent support - very empathetic, impressive in how she retained details of my specific issues, creative in her suggestions to help improve aspects of my problem, and I am sure that her guidance and probing with the right questions helped me to overcome the negative feelings I was having at the time. it was also very clear how passionate she is about the importance of people taking their mental health seriously, as they would do more physical problems, I would have no hesitation in recommending the back on track programme to other people who are struggling with mental health. I would also recommend the presentation on stress management - very well put together.

author: Lollypops
title: Removal of basal cell carcinoma
body:
David and Dawn, up at Forth Valley Hospital, saw me at such short notice. We're great fun, made me feel right at home-and comfortable. Chatted away with their friendly demeanour which took all notice off what was happening. Was quick and painless, and extremely fascinating to see once all was done.  
Cannot thank them both enough for everything-quick easy, and absolutely lovely pair of people. Thank you so much!!

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: Lollypops
title: Hemithyroidectomy
body:
The team that overseen by procedure Dr Winkler-were utterly professional and so considerate. They made sure all details were covered before going in for the op-and ensured all details were correct. My anaesthetist-was kind and ensured I was well directly after-she also made me feel comfortable and calm which made the drifting off to sleep so easy. Even the training staff that were present throughout have been nothing but wonderful and thoughtful.  
They were supportive and ensured I felt comfortable, and no request was too big or too small!! They are a wonderful team-and I feel very blessed to have been in their hands for this procedure. The aftercare team that have nursed and administered me after the op have been friendly and just utterly lovely bunch of people. Thank you!! Cannot compliment this Hospital enough-Forth Valley Hospital in this case-Day Surgery get well beyond a 5 star rating from me everytime!!

author: Boatie
title: Mixed Responses by Crisis Team
body:
I'm going through a lot of changes and not coping well. My GP asked the Crisis Team to get in touch. One of the changes is that my child is soon leaving home, and I am already anticipating how that loss will affect me. I'm not sure why, but I was called selfish by a member of the Crisis Team who rang me, which only added to my distress. I have encouraged my child to be independent and never tried (or wanted) to stop them, so why was I being selfish by admitting to this stranger how much I love my child, that I will miss them, and how I anticipate how much I will struggle to cope? I can only hope that there was some miscommunication, but I was left feeling worse than before I'd been offered 'help'.  
Another team member arranged to see me in a face to face appointment, and I'm very grateful for that. I have never found it easy talking on the phone and to be given a real appointment shows they value you as they are prepared to give you time. These two members of staff present were very kind, caring, sensitive, understanding and respectful, all of the things missing from the team member who rang me first.  
Things are still very difficult, not helped by being told a few days later by phone that there wasn't much the team could do for me. I had understood from the person who arranged our face to face that they'd be able to support me. But I appreciate that face to face appointment as it made me feel that I was worth bothering with and trying to help, and not just the selfish person I'd been made to feel I was earlier.  
So, thank you to this member of staff.

title: Great service
body: We had our first Coronavius shot (Astra Zeneca) in early March and everyone was very friendly, helpful, efficient and super fast.  We where done within 5 minutes.  Amazing! Can't wait for my 2nd shot

title: Great practice and so well organised
body:
I have visited today for my 2nd vaccine and I would like to thank the practice for how it is run.
Both visits were so well organised,greeted with a smile ,the vaccine was given so gentle and with really useful information and reassurance was given to me as I am nervous of needles .Well done Fosse Medical Centre ,you should all be extremely proud of yourselves.
Thank you

title: Patient Friendly Practice
body:
Nice experience with the surgery, very friendly people. They take good care especially in this difficult covid times. 

Timely advise & guidance by the doctors, pharmacists and the team have  made to reverse my medical conditions in 6-7 months

title: Excellent service
body: i went for routine blood test, the nurses was so caring , they made feel at ease, i never liked to visit GP in the past, now that i feel comfortable and the staff made it so easy , also my doctor called me immediately to discuss my blood result made it fantastic surgery to deal with.. thank you

title: Really good practice
body: Both doctors and nurses are both caring and professional ! I have been really impressed with how thorough and persistent they were with my treatment . Excellent!

title: Great Practice
body: Brilliant service provided by all the staff, always helpful and cheerful. I have been a patient here for over 10 years now and never had a problem with any of the reception staff or doctors.

title: Very considerate practice
body: I have phobia of needles and staff really assisted when having the co vid vaccine. They were sympathetic and understanding of my worries. I was put at ease, the vaccination was painless and very quick.

title: Heathrow Vaccination Centre
body: The building was easy to locate and park. Really efficient staff, very helpful. The place was clean and tidy and well signposted. I was in and out with my vaccine in under 30mins.

title: So professional and efficient
body: I have to say how good I‚Äôve found Portview surgery in a professional friendly & efficient manner. I know that booking appointments with your GP are not always available immediately but I like the fact you can book a phone call with a doctor within a day or so and they can decide a plan of action. From either prescriptions - advice - appointments with the nurse or an appointment that day in more urgent cases. A big thank you to all the staff.

title: Great practice
body: All my sessions helped me understand and break down my feelings and thoughts and understand them better. I felt as if I was able to talk freely.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Great practice
body: My wife and I have both our vaccinations at your surgery and we could not have been more impressed with the efficiency,kindness and speed at which they were carried out. We thank you for all your care and dedication. You are a credit to the NHS.

title: Great Practice
body: Helpful friendly team. Called with an urgent issue and the GP called me back within the hour. So happy that I could speak to a doctor the same day. Thank you

title: Very kind friendly staff
body: I took my teenage daughter to have some blood tests, she was feeling very nervous. After a wait we were greeted by a very friendly nurse who made us feel very reassured and was very friendly and professional. Thank you for this lovely experience.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Covid 19 Jab
body: Truly humbling - lots of volunteers, extremely efficient and friendly. Very quick and a massive thank you.

title: Not understanding
body:
My partner visited the hospital for a scan on his elbow. We both understand that the global pandemic is affecting every practice at the moment however, my partner has ADHD and Dyslexia, so being able to do tasks such as relaying information, asking questions or filing out paperwork can be extremely difficult tasks. We asked if I could just wait with him (the waiting room was completely empty at this point too) so that we could discuss questions to ask/ fill out any paperwork needed. It is vital that he receives the care he needs due to having an operation prior to the appointment that could have been unsuccessful. Without my presence, asking questions or retaining information that could be useful in his recovery would prove difficult and could danger his speed of recovery and waste of medical time/equipment to only have to come back again.
We feel his care was let down, as no Practitioner he has ever been under has been understanding of his difficulties in reading and writing.

title: Covid Vaccination
body: Wonderful service, staff very sympathetic to my needle phobia, everyone made me feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble, a great service and lovely staff, made my visit so much less stressful, thank you

title: Full marks
body: Thank you PMG  for your excellent administration of the AZ vaccine.    We are very grateful to have had our "jabs" at the surgery;  the whole process from initial contact to receiving the vaccination was dealt with in a professional, efficient and caring way.   Full marks from two grateful patients.

title: Excellent Vaccination Group
body: Coming here for the covid jab I found a well organised surgery ready to administer the jab and to accommodate people in the observation  areas afterwards. The smooth running of the queue, the friendly helpers and the care given to the people waiting was outstanding. Well done- you are a great example to others!!

title: Excellent service
body: Had my 1st Covid 19 vaccine jab this morning. The service at Fosse Medical Centre was friendly, professional and very efficient.

title: Faultless
body: I visited the Treatment and Investigation Unit yesterday and was so impressed by the organisation, the caring staff, and the amazing cleanliness of the Unit and the Covid precautions taken. I was kept fully informed of what to expect and when to expect it from the nursing staff who were both professional and kind. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful service for COVID Jab
body: Just wanted to say thank you to staff and volunteers for the ease and professionalism, topped off with great organisational planning and operating by staff and volunteers when I attended this week for my covid jab. I was a little nervous beforehand but it all ran so smoothly all the nerves disappeared thank you

title: Great, knowledgable friendly team.
body: A great practice that runs like clockwork. All staff I‚Äôve seen are friendly, knowledgeable and put you at ease. I received a fantastic service and nothing takes too much time or effort. I‚Äôd definitely recommend them.

title: Great practice staffed by lovely people
body: Visited today for my vaccine and it was so organised. All paperwork was ready, the team were so warm and friendly and I was in and out before I knew what had happened. Super efficient and thanks to all of them for their efforts in the vaccination program

author: Tangerinetwirly
title: Immunotherapy Clinic
body: I have been attending Dr Ram's Immunotherapy Clinic for Pollinex injections for the last 14months. The staff have been fantastic, very friendly & welcoming. Unfortunately I have to travel some distance to attend this clinic but it has been worth it. I still have another year of treatment to have in 2022 but already I have felt a big difference in my hayfever & asthma symptoms. Summer & Autumn 2020 were the best my asthma has been for several years and I was even able to reduce my steroid inhaler dose for the first time ever. I am confident that this treatment is going to make a big difference to my health & my life.

author: CMacR
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Learning Disability Care in Forth Valley
body:
I am a manager in adult social care services in the Forth Valley area, we look after adults with very complex needs and health complications. Recently a gentleman we support had to be admitted to Forth Valley Royal at probably the worst time, a severe spike in Covid cases, the hospital was at capacity and very much under pressure, (he did not have Covid but was very unwell). The hospital staff were trying their best but with someone who can not eat, drink, bathroom or even ask for help without assistance it was clear this was going to be difficult.  
We were aware of a Learning Disability Liaison Nurse, Jemma, who became a vital link between us and the hospital. Through Jemma we were able to have staff in the ward 8am-8pm to provide the intense support the gentleman requires with people who understand him and he can trust despite having no verbal or even obvious communication we know him very well.  
The care was generally very good, the staff were excellent but it is necessary to have someone with a knowledge of learning disabilities to help with complex patients, and to act as a link between care provider and medical staff. We were able to share protocols with Jemma to help staff identify pain and discomfort when we were not there, to describe typical communication and what it might mean.  
This role should be more widely available in all hospitals and more care providers should know about the vital work that the LD Liaison nurses do.

author: yar1950
title: accident on Sunday
body:
I had a accident last Sunday and attended the Queen Victoria minor injuries unit to have quite a severe finger cut stitched with eight stitches.  
I would like say how impressed I was with the staff and service provided. Nick and Sarah‚Äôs professionalism was second to none. The cleaning, preparation and especially the stitching was excellent. They were very polite and caring and made me feel special. I hope I don‚Äôt have to visit again soon for medical treatment but if I did it would be a pleasure to be treated by Nick and Sarah. The lady on the reception was also very helpful.

author: Impatient for Change
title: Pressure on staff
body: I‚Äôm not reporting on one good or bad incident, rather a cumulation of experiences. Yes the reception staff do appear to be disgruntled which often manifests as a negative attitude, which for the patient can be upsetting. However, the staff in general are just like the rest of us, frustrated at the system which they have no power to change, unfortunately I feel this can and often does result in a passive aggressive response to the patient‚Äôs. I think they are just as frustrated with management who are not running an efficient or patient centric system.The system of booking an appointment is just ridiculously difficult and the pharmacy service is appalling. I wonder if the lack of an alternative medical practice for the patients is the only reason this once highly regarded surgery is oversubscribed, as given an option I‚Äôm sure many would choose an alternative practice. I suppose that is where the problem lies, in the notion that because they are so popular in terms of number of patients it is percieved as being successful, yet in terms of patient satisfaction I feel that they are at the bottom of the list. I‚Äôll end on a positive note by saying that yes, there are some excellent medical staff practicing at the surgery and generally the admin and reception team are lovely human beings, who given half the chance could excel in their role if they could work with a system that is woefully outdated and inefficient. Come on Eden Surgery it‚Äôs time for investment for the people you employ and the infrastructure that surrounds them.

author: Mumzo Wood
title: Superb care at The Global Clinic in Norwich
body:
I attended for an MRI scan at The Global Clinic in Norwich this morning.  
I received superb care from start to finish. The staff were very kind and attentive. Covid-19/other infection control regulations were thoroughly and carefully adhered to. The surroundings and the scanning experience were very comfortable.  
I very much appreciate the care and kind attention I was given - thanks again to the staff involved.

author: Julie2104
title: The wonderful care I received for day procedure
body:
I had to attend the Ulster hospital recently for hysteroscopy and biopsy. I was nervous but was quickly put at ease by the wonderful nurses around me. They went about their hectic schedule ensuring we were all comfortable and they had wee smiles on their faces.  
I particularly was impressed by the attention from these ladies in my ward, Janna and Debbie, they just made the whole experience a much more pleasant one which no one would ever have imagined. I felt in the best possible care.  
I never got the full name of the wonderful lady in the Recovery room. I just remember she was called Sharon and she had 2 boys, she was the nicest lady and showed such compassion. Honestly felt so important and well looked after by these amazing ladies. üëè‚ù§

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Posse 1965
title: Every staff member has been so caring and empathetic
body:
My mum was admitted on Mother‚Äôs Day to the Royal Alexandra Hospital in Paisley with a suspected stroke (since confirmed) from the acute ward to ward 4 as now.  
My mum and I are very close and I‚Äôve been very emotional as this is her second stroke. Every staff member has been so caring and empathetic towards mum and even me. Please pass on my heartfelt thanks to all of them for their care and dedication for what must be doubly hard work for all of them at the moment due to COVID-19.  
A special thank you to Charge Nurse Tracy for her understanding and I have to say ‚Äòthorough‚Äô as she‚Äôd asked if I had ‚Äòpower of attorney‚Äò for mum as I am estranged from my brother and she totally understood.  
Once again thank you to all NHS workers.

author: CFF
title: Patient confidentiality
body:
Although the care which I received when I had surgery in York Hospitality some years ago was exemplary to the extent that I wrote to you chief executive with thanks to the team which looked after me, there was one matter with which I was very unhappy and that was the lack of confidentiality.  
On the occasion that my husband and son visited together one of the nurses embarrassingly took me to task over the matter of the amount that I has drunk one night leading to remarks made regarding my urinary matters and when it had been decided that I was to have more time in hospital, it was my husband who was informed, rather than me, both of these things constituted a breach of confidentiality and were unacceptable.  
I decided at the time not to make an issue of it so as not to dilute the effect of my letter of thanks, but to make contact at a later date; time has passed and a conversation has led me to write to you now in the hope that my remarks will be taken on board and other patients may benefit as it is really not good enough when a patient is well enough to receive communication regarding matters relating to them that information is passed to or in the presence of someone else.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: turkeyxz38
title: Swanage staff were amazing with my dad
body:
I got this leaflet through from the bereavement support service, a letter from Matron Donna, and I wanted to share our family's experience with Swanage Hospital. They Were Amazing.  
My dad actually had a stroke and ended up in another hospital, where he caught covid because he was placed in a covid ward even though he didn't have it - the hospital had other options they chose not to use.  
Luckily, he was transferred to Swanage. The care he received, and we as a family received, was outstanding. Thank goodness his last days were spent with such care, such compassion - obviously, as a family we weren't able to spend any time with him until right up to the end, and they were absolute angels.  
If anyone else was in a similar position, and I wouldn't wish it on anyone, but I wouldn't hesitate to send any friend or family member to Swanage Hospital.  
I have nothing but praise for the way they kept us informed as a family, they let us know everything that happened, and as he was very distressed he took a lot of their time, but they always gave such compassionate care to him.  
Of course, it was absolutely devastating for all of us, but especially after such bad treatment from the previous hospital, we couldn't believe there could be such a difference between two NHS hospitals. The hospital is only as good as its staff, and these staff members were amazing with my dad Michael, right up to the end.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

author: oscarpg39
title: Excellent staff and care
body:
Attended Hysteroscopy Clinic @ Lincoln County Hospital - Marie, Nicky and Ania were excellent.  
Explained exactly what was happening at each point and continuously checked on my welfare. They really put me at ease.  
Thank you so much ladies, you are all a credit to your profession and we are lucky to have you.

author: BarelyFarmer
title: Immunotherapy treatment
body: I've been attending woodend hospital ENT department for annual immunotherapy injections for severe tree and grass pollen allergies now for two years, this is a viewed by some as an expensive treatment and some may question it's importance, but as a long term allergy sufferer I can vouch that if this is successful it will actually save the NHS money in the long run, Every year before treatment I was going through boxes of antihistamines and nasal sprays and eye drops, not to mention lotions and creams and ointments, this treatment also helped me stay in work and made a huge improvement to my quality of life.

author: flutent95
title: Wonderful vaccination service
body: Everyone was very organised and efficient, but very kind as well.

author: positivethinking84
title: Great Phone First Service
body:
My other half never visits the doctor but recently he has had to use the phone first service twice. Once for a gammy ear (which resembled a beetroot on his ear lobe) and yesterday because of a cellulitis to his arm which he sustained by looking 'busy' in the garden at the weekend.  
Once I noticed that the infection had started to track up his arm, I knew it was time to get him seen (because if he lost the arm, he'd have an excuse to do no gardening at all).  
Anyway, the nurse on the phone was great and very personable. He was given an appointment in Causeway ED. I have to say I was looking forward to a few hours peace and an evening of Salvage Hunters. Imagine my surprise when he got back after just an hour! Arm sorted and antibiotics to cover. So, thanks to the Nurse on the phone and to the Doctor who sorted his arm out (and ruined my evening of television) ;-)  
A very efficient service indeed! #TeamNorth

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: KML2087
title: Support during miscarriage
body: I would like to say a massive thank you to the nurses in NHS Lothian's Pregnancy Support Centre during my recent miscarriage. The nurses (particularly Lucy) were amazing. So supportive and caring whilst myself and my husband were going through this emotional time. They spent a lot of time talking us through the process and answering our questions, whilst also providing us with shoulder to cry on. They really are a credit to NHS Lothian, and I can't thank them enough.

author: Full of Praise
title: Getting my first Covid vaccination
body:
Want to say a special ‚Äúthank you‚Äù to all involved in the set up and delivery of the Covid Vaccines at South Lake Leisure Centre, Craigavon.  
An excellent layout ensured privacy for each patient, plenty of staff were available to direct patients. The whole experience was very reassuring for first time nervous patients. All staff acted most professionally and deserve high recommendation. Sanitation facilities were to a high standard.  
Only one minor point - on visiting the toilet facility the only toilet roll available was sitting on top of the cistern. This meant that each patient would handle the toilet roll and leave back for next user - maybe not the most hygienic! A toilet roll holder would afford better cleanliness.  
Otherwise I have nothing but praise for staff and overall flow of patients. Thank you!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
